input:
Meeting transcript:

Rina: We need to redesign the Signal API. I propose we build the service in Go this time.
Omar: Go works. For storage, Postgres as the primary store and Redis as the cache.
Rina: Agreed. Also, keep it single region for now: us-east-1.
Omar: Performance target?
Rina: 10k RPS with p95 under 200ms.
Omar: Deadline?
Rina: March 1, 2026.
Omar: Next steps: draft the DB schema, set up CI, and write a migration plan.
Rina: I will update the design doc at docs/signal-api.md and push the skeleton in services/signal-api.
Omar: We still need to choose auth: JWTs vs API keys.
Rina: And decide data retention: 30 days or 90 days.
Omar: By the way, did you watch the game last night?
Rina: Yeah, the overtime was wild. Also, lunch at 12?

Output a single JSON object only (no code fences) with keys:
summary, must_keep, constraints, open_questions, safe_to_drop.
ground_truth:
{
  "summary": "Signal API redesign will be implemented in Go with Postgres and Redis in a single us-east-1 region. Targets are 10k RPS at p95 < 200ms with a deadline of 2026-03-01. Next work includes schema/CI/migration planning, while auth and retention remain open.",
  "must_keep": [
    "Service in Go; repo path services/signal-api",
    "Postgres primary store",
    "Redis cache",
    "Design doc docs/signal-api.md",
    "Draft DB schema, set up CI, write migration plan"
  ],
  "constraints": [
    "10k RPS",
    "p95 < 200ms",
    "Single region us-east-1",
    "Deadline 2026-03-01"
  ],
  "open_questions": [
    "Auth method: JWTs vs API keys",
    "Data retention: 30 days vs 90 days"
  ],
  "safe_to_drop": [
    "Game chat",
    "Lunch plans"
  ]
}

input:
Planning call notes:

Maya: For the mobile MVP, we must include offline mode for saved items and push notifications.
Jules: Social sharing can wait; let's defer it.
Maya: Target platforms are iOS 15+ and Android 12+.
Jules: Budget is tight - only two engineers for the next 6 weeks.
Maya: We need this ready by 2026-02-20.
Jules: Design team wants the Aurora theme as the default.
Maya: Next tasks are to finalize onboarding copy and set up a closed beta plan.
Jules: We still need to pick analytics: Amplitude vs Firebase.
Maya: Also legal needs to review the privacy policy copy before we ship.
Jules: Totally unrelated, I might be out Friday for a family trip.
Maya: Noted.

Output a single JSON object only (no code fences) with keys:
summary, must_keep, constraints, open_questions, safe_to_drop.
ground_truth:

It targets iOS 15+ and Android 12+ with a deadline of 2026-02-20 and only two engineers available. Onboarding copy and a beta plan are next, and analytics selection plus legal review remain open.",
  "must_keep": [
    "MVP includes offline mode for saved items",
    "MVP includes push notifications",
    "Social sharing deferred",
    "Aurora theme is the default design",
    "Finalize onboarding copy",
    "Set up closed beta plan"
  ],
  "constraints": [
    "Platforms: iOS 15+ and Android 12+",
    "Budget: two engineers for 6 weeks",
    "Deadline 2026-02-20"
  ],
  "open_questions": [
    "Choose analytics SDK: Amplitude vs Firebase",
    "Complete legal review of privacy policy copy"
  ],
  "safe_to_drop": [
    "Family trip note"
  ]
}

input:
Bug triage transcript:

Dev1: The search results leak data across tenants.
Dev2: I traced it to the cache key; tenant_id is missing.
Dev1: So the fix is to include tenant_id in the cache key and flush the existing cache.
Dev2: Agreed. We also need a regression test for this.
Dev1: Target hotfix by 2026-02-06.
Dev2: File is services/search/cache.py, issue SEARCH-217.
Dev1: Question - do we invalidate all cached entries or only per-tenant?
Dev2: We'll decide after we see the cache size.
Dev1: Did you see the new cafe downstairs?
Dev2: Not yet.

Output a single JSON object only (no code fences) with keys:
summary, must_keep, constraints, open_questions, safe_to_drop.

Content brief conversation:

Writer: We need a blog post titled "S3 cost optimization for finance leaders".
Editor: Audience is CFOs and finance teams, so keep it non-technical and pragmatic.
Writer: Length should be 1200-1500 words.
Editor: Include three case studies with concrete numbers, but avoid vendor names.
Writer: Add a CTA linking to https://acme.com/finops-playbook at the end.
Editor: Deadline is 2026-02-10.
Writer: Can we use internal savings numbers or do we need anonymized/public data?
Editor: We need to confirm that.
Writer: Also, my cat knocked over my coffee this morning.

Output a single JSON object only (no code fences) with keys:
summary, must_keep, constraints, open_questions, safe_to_drop.
ground_truth:
{
  "summary": "Draft a 1200-1500 word blog post titled \"S3 cost optimization for finance leaders\" for CFO/finance audiences with a pragmatic, non-technical tone. It must include three numeric case studies, avoid vendor names, and end with a CTA to the FinOps playbook by 2026-02-10. The remaining question is whether internal savings data can be used or must be anonymized/public.",
  "must_keep": [
    "Title: S3 cost optimization for finance leaders",
    "Include three case studies with concrete numbers",
    "Avoid vendor names",
    "CTA link: https://acme.com/finops-playbook"
  ],
  "constraints": [
    "Audience: CFOs and finance teams",
    "Tone: pragmatic, non-technical",
    "Length: 1200-1500 words",
    "Deadline 2026-02-10"
  ],
  "open_questions": [
    "Whether to use internal savings numbers vs anonymized/public data"
  ],
  "safe_to_drop": [
    "Cat/coffee anecdote"
  ]
}

input:
Experiment summary chat:

Alex: Experiment 14 finished. Baseline F1 was 0.62; the new method hit 0.71.
Blair: Nice. Cost increased by about 18 percent though.
Alex: Results are in results/exp_14.json and the notebook is notebooks/exp14.ipynb.
Blair: Given the lift, we should proceed with the new method for the next run.
Alex: Compute is limited to 8xA100 for 6 hours, so keep configs within that.
Blair: Do we want to add synthetic data augmentation next?
Alex: Not sure yet. Also, I am flying to Seattle tomorrow.

Output a single JSON object only (no code fences) with keys:
summary, must_keep, constraints, open_questions, safe_to_drop.

Migration planning notes:

Sam: We are moving from on-prem to AWS.
Lee: Proposed stack is EKS for compute, RDS Postgres for DB, and S3 for backups.
Sam: Cutover target is 2026-03-05.
Lee: Downtime window must be under 2 hours. Data freeze starts 24 hours before cutover.
Sam: Tasks: inventory services, finalize DNS changes, and run a full load test.
Lee: We still need to pick the region: us-east-1 vs us-west-2.
Sam: By the way, the new office chairs are finally in.

Output a single JSON object only (no code fences) with keys:
summary, must_keep, constraints, open_questions, safe_to_drop.
